EVTTOOLTIP40026: will be exposed as an employer of assassins.
EVTDESC40026: Not only did our assassin get discovered, he also managed to implicate that we were behind it.  Now [From.GetBestName] is showing proofs to everyone in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] that we have broken our feudal contract with a vassal.
EVTDESC3260: I am not the most martial of rulers and sometimes it appears as if I am almost incompetent when it comes to behaving like a knight. Luckily, I know how to manipulate people...
EVTOPTA3260: Talk the talk and Talk the talk..
EVTDESC3261: I simply can not keep up with handling the day to day business of my demesne. I rely on others, but manipulate them to believe that I am doing the harder things.
EVTOPTA3261: Talk the talk and Talk the talk..
EVTDESC3262: Sometimes the niceties of diplomacy pass me by and puts me in awkward positions. However, by careful manipulation of my court, I've managed to let my courtiers take the blame when things go bad.
EVTDESC3263: I am not a bookish person and if it weren't for some careful comments in some discussions this would become obvious to my court.
EVTOPTA3263: Talk the talk and Talk the talk..
EVTDESC73200: It is sad that [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] is employing [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] as [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] marshal. I am more competent and would be a better marshal!
EVTTOOLTIP73201: will listen to our petition and hopefully make a wise choice
EVTDESC73201: [From.GetBestName] claims that [From.GetSheHe] would be a better marshal than [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName], and petitions that [From.GetSheHe] should be given the title of Marshal of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
EVTDESC73202: My liege [From.GetBestName] is not entirely happy with our performance as Marshal of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], and is considering our replacement..
EVTDESC73203: Enough time has passed, I deserve to become Marshal of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], and [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] will make me it!
EVTTOOLTIP73204: will listen to our petition and hopefully make a wise choice
EVTDESC73205:

I hereby grant you the title as Marshal of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].

EVTTOOLTIP73241: will listen to our petition and hopefully make a wise choice

EVTOPTA3237: I do not need [From.GetHerHis] advice anyway.
EVTDESC3140: I know I am not the best warrior in the realm, but I so wish I was. There are men who appear to be better than me, and I wish I was like them!
EVTDESC3141: Those that talk to sweetly at court are great at diplomacy. I begrudge them their ability, and I covet it for myself.
EVTDESC3142: I covet the stewardship ability of some of the people at court. I deserve to be better at managing my economy.
EVTDESC3143: There are so many great manipulators in the court, and I almost admire their skills if it weren't for the fact that I wish I had what they have.
EVTDESC3144: There are people in the court that are so dedicated to learning. I wish I was more like them, and it vexes me that I am not.
EVTDESC3145: I am still childless, and there are women at court with children who are younger than me. I should be the one with a young and healthy son in my arms.
EVTOPTA3145: Tell one of them how fat she is!
EVTOPTC3145: Try to look more attractive to my man
EVTDESC3115: One of the priests seems to have noticed that I fell asleep during his sermons this Sunday. I simply can't understand why slothfulness is not considered to be a virtue..
EVTDESC3116: I was greatly upset when the slothful [From.GetTitledFirstName] fell asleep during my sermon!
EVTDESC3117: It seems that [From.GetTitledFirstName] is upset about me falling asleep during [From.GetHerHis] sermon. Now [From.GetSheHe] is giving me a long lecture about dedication to the Church.
EVTOPTB3100: I don't even have time for church.
EVTDESC3280: There is just so many sinners at court. I am just too honest a person to keep quiet when I see someone with a vice.
EVTDESC3281: [From.GetBestName] has utterly embarrassed me in front of the entire court. [From.GetSheHeCap] is claiming that I am sinful and full of vice.
EVTDESC3282: I am torn between my honesty and my ability to intrigue. It is stressful to attempt to be both, and I simply do not know how I should behave at times.
EVTOPTA3282: I should be more of a diplomat.
EVTDESC3283: I know when someone is a good ruler, and my liege, [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] is a [Root.Liege.GetManWoman] with virtues. [Root.Liege.GetSheHeCap] deserves praise and respect.
EVTDESC3284: My faithful vassal, [From.GetBestName] is rather honest, and have publicly spoken about my virtues. This has radicalized my vassals, where some agree and some do not.
EVTDESC3285: My dear [This.GetTitle], I wanted to thank you for your virtuous rule. You are an inspiration to me.\n\n[From.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTDESC3286: There are vassals we have that deserve praise for their virtues. I can not keep quiet about it, and I need to give the proper respect, or I am not an honest person anymore.
EVTTOOLTIP3288: will get our sack of gold.
EVTDESC3287: My dear [This.GetTitle], you are a role model for my realm. Your virtues is exactly what I require from a [This.GetTitle].\n\n[From.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTDESC3288: My dear [This.GetTitle], I wanted to thank you for your virtuous rule as my vassal. Maybe this sack of gold will help you feel rewarded.\n\n[From.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTDESC3495: There are so many people out to get me. Their eyes are staring at me constantly, and I am sure they are plotting against me in open sight.
EVTOPTA3495: Avoid open spaces, they are dangerous
EVTDESC3240: True humility is about showing humility when it is against our desires. A humble [Root.GetManWoman] submits to proper authority, even if [Root.GetSheHe] dislikes his lawful liege.
EVTOPTB3240: I will never bend my knee
EVTDESC3241: My dear [This.GetTitle], I am your humble servant, and while I may not have always viewed you as favourably as I should, I sincerely regret my behavior.\n[From.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTDESC3242: True humility is about showing humility when it is against our desires. A humble [Root.GetManWoman] submits to God, even if [Root.GetSheHe] may dislike the Pope himself.
EVTOPTA3242: Submit to the Throne of St. Peter
EVTDESC3243: Recognising virtues and talents that other possess is truly a virtue. I am truly blessed by having a Marshal that is more formidable warrior than I could ever dream of being.
EVTDESC3244: My dear [This.GetTitle]. I just wished to inform you of how much I appreciate your talent and recognize that it beyond my own.\n[From.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTDESC3258: I am very ambitious, but I also know that I am not great at everything. Being humble means I can recognize the limit of my talent, and not reach for what is beyond my grasp.
EVTDESC3245: Recognising virtues and talents that other possess is a virtue. I am truly blessed by having a [Root.GetChancellorName] who is a marvel at diplomacy.
EVTDESC3246: Recognising virtues and talents that other possess is truly a virtue. I am truly blessed by having a Spymaster who is brilliant in rooting out plots.
EVTDESC3247: Recognising virtues and talents that other possess is truly a virtue. I am truly blessed by having a [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] who is a devout teacher.
EVTDESC3248: Recognising virtues and talents that other possess is truly a virtue. I am truly blessed by having a Steward that truly knows how to govern a realm.
indulgence_ask: The Holy Father will hear our plea for salvation.
EVTDESC39250: An emissary comes from [From.GetBestName], with hopes of buying indulgences to clean [From.GetHerHis] sins. While [From.GetSheHe] has committed some very grave sins, this shows sincere regret.
EVTTOOLTIP39251: will cry tears of joy at our reply.
EVTDESC39251: The Holy Father has granted us absolution!
EVTDESC39230: A procession of monks have arrived at our castle, protesting that we are keeping a Bishop in our prison. They claim that we are sinning against the law of God!
EVTDESC39240: There are rumors that one of the rulers of Christendom is employing a heathen in their court. This is not acceptable to the Church, and this earthly lord will surely be damned unless we intervene.
EVTOPTA39240: Demand adherence to the Throne of St. Peter!
EVTDESC39241: An emissary from [From.GetTitledFirstName] has arrived in our court. According to the emissary, the Holy Father is concerned about our employment of heathens as advisors.  The Pope is asking of me to remove them from position.
EVTDESC39243: An emissary has returned from [From.GetBestName] bearing glorious news. The emissary says that [From.GetTitledFirstName] has agreed to imprison a heathen that was in [From.GetHerHis] court.
EVTDESC39244: This is a day that the has caused cries of joy to rise up from the pits of hell. An emissary from  [From.GetBestName] is stating that [From.GetSheHe] refuse to follow our demands.
EVTOPTA39244: My God, why have you forsaken me?
EVTDESC39260: There are rumors that one of the rulers of Christendom is employing a heathen in their court. This is not acceptable to the Church, and this earthly lord will surely be damned unless we intervene.
EVTOPTA39260: Demand adherence to the True Faith!
EVTDESC39261: An emissary from [From.GetTitledFirstName] has arrived in our court. According to the emissary, [From.GetSheHe] is concerned about our employment of heathens as advisors.  The Patriarch is asking of me to remove them from position.
EVTOPTA39261: Banish the heathen from our realm.
EVTDESC39262: An emissary has returned from [From.GetBestName] bearing glorious news. The emissary says that [From.GetTitledFirstName] has agreed to banish a heathen that was in [From.GetHerHis] court.
EVTDESC39263: An emissary has returned from [From.GetBestName] bearing glorious news. The emissary says that [From.GetTitledFirstName] has agreed to imprison a heathen that was in [From.GetHerHis] court.
EVTDESC39264: This is a day that the has caused cries of joy to rise up from the pits of hell. An emissary from  [From.GetBestName] is stating that [From.GetSheHe] refuse to follow our demands.
EVTOPTA39264: My God, why have you forsaken me?
EVTDESC39270: There is an errant bishop in one of the catholic realms. Rumours speak of him pledging allegiance to his earthly master ahead of God.
EVTOPTA39270: Send an emissary to have him replaced.
EVTDESC39271: The Holy Father is most concerned about the loyalties of the bishops of our realm. [From.GetBestName] is asking for us to replace one of them with a bishop.
EVTDESC39272: An emissary has returned from [From.GetBestName] bearing glorious news. The errant bishop is no longer in a position of authority.
EVTDESC39273: Our emissary has returned from [From.GetBestName]. The news he bring is dire indeed, as [From.GetBestName] is refusing to follow our demands.
EVTDESC39275: We have loyal bishops in other realms. Perhaps we should return them to their de-jure rulers, so that they can guide their earthly lieges.
EVTDESC39276: The Holy Father wishes to inform us that we will now also obey an early liege.
EVTDESC39277: The Holy Father has granted you the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. We will serve you faithfully as a vassal, and guide your rule in a Christian way.
IMPRISON_INTERACTION_1: Using this option is viewed as tyrannical, and will lower all of your subjects' opinion of you by §R$OPINION$§!.
EXECUTE_IMPRISONED_INTERACTION_1: Using this option is viewed as tyrannical, and will lower all of your vassals' opinion of you by §R$OPINION$§!.
other_dejure_county_claim_desc: The §Y$TITLE$§! is, de jure, a vassal of §Y$CLAIMANT$'s§!, which is cause enough for war.
other_dejure_barony_claim_desc: The §Y$TITLE$§! is, de jure, a vassal of §Y$CLAIMANT$'s§!, which is cause enough for war.
EVTDESC80053: Tired of their old ruler [From.GetTitledName], the peasant rebels of [Root.GetName] have defected and sworn allegiance to me!
LEADER_APP_NEEDS_LAW_NO_CROWN_TITLE: Your nobles are too autonomous to accept being replaced as leaders.\n(Crown Authority is too low.)
CHAR_EXCOM_LOG: §Y$REL_HEAD$§! has excommunicated §Y$VICTIM$§! at the behest of §Y$ACTOR$§!!
CHAR_EXCOM_LIFTED_LOG: §Y$REL_HEAD$§! has lifted the excommunication of §Y$VICTIM$§! at the behest of §Y$ACTOR$§!!
plot_gain_title_desc: [From.GetBestName] is plotting to become ruler of the [This.GetFullName].
FE_CONFIRM_LOAD_OLD_DESC: A partida gardada seleccionada ten a versión $VERSION$, e a versión actual é $CURRVERSION$. \nCargar este ficheiro podería levar un comportamento anómalo, ou incluso provocar que o xogo deixe de responder. Continuar de todos os modos?
EVTDESC4075: The day did not bring any game at all, it had been a futile hunting trip with my guests and my face still burned with shame when the gamekeeper told me about deer parks.
EVTDESC4105: The Summer Fair brings all kinds of entertainers to [Root.Location.GetName] and a puppet show got my attention when I heard the giggles, laughter and wolf-whistles from its audience. After watching the show for a while, I realized that one of the characters was supposed to be me!
EVTDESC72009: When I opened the door I saw no one but as I stepped aside to close it a group of acrobats cartwheeled, somersaulted and tumbled in. They performed all sorts of tricks and everyone watching exploded into applause when they finished.
EVTOPTA72009: You would be perfect for my feast!
EVTOPTB72009: Get out! What do you think you are doing?!
EVTDESC4160: The acrobats performed somersaults, cartwheels and tumbles with great skill during the course of my feast. One of them arrived in a chest seemingly too small to hold a person but he showed us how he, by distorting his body, could fit into the chest...
EVTDESC72115: I almost forgot to eat when I saw the acrobats performing during [From.GetTitledFirstName] and I was the first one to start applauding when their performance was done, wishing they would do just one more somersault, or cartwheel, or even tumble...
EVTDESC72116: [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s plate was still almost full when the acrobats had finished their performance and [From.GetSheHe] applauded almost frantically with a blissed look in [From.GetHerHis] eyes.
EVTDESC4170: Its ragged fur and sorrowful eyes made the bear look pitiful, but when its trainer started playing his flute the bear started dancing. The dancing bear and his trainer travelled from fair to fair and this year they came to the Summer Fair in [Root.Location.GetName].
EVTDESC24510: I died while I was serving [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName], now I hope [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] will honor my last wish and bury me properly...
EVTOPTA24510: Keep your promise or I will haunt you, forever!
EVTDESC4140: [From.GetTitledFirstName] had made me promise I would bury [From.GetHerHim] properly and I keep my promises. I walked beside [From.GetHerHis] coffin to [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s last rest and the wailing of the mourners was almost more than I could bear. [From.GetSheHeCap] died too young!
NOT_SELECT: §Y$PLAYER$§! must select a character to play!
LOADING_TIP_15: Right-click a received message to change its priority or appearance.
LOADING_TIP_19: Press F10 to save a snapshot of the mapmode you currently have selected.
LOADING_TIP_21: Press F11 to save a screenshot of the game.
EVTDESC20133:
My liege, my work in [FromFrom.Location.GetName] seem to have come to fruition. By bribing, cajoling, extorting, threatening and forging documents, I have managed to fabricate a claim on the [FromFrom.Location.Duchy.GetFullName] presently held by [From.GetTitledName]. I leave it up to you whether to press it or not.

Your humble [Root.GetChancellorName],
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
action_fabricate_claims_desc: Send your [GetChancellorName] to fabricate claims on landed titles held by local rulers. Highly skilled [GetChancellorName]s may even fabricate a claim on a duchy.
EVTDESC3440: I stumbled into a courtier eating cookies outside the kitchen. The courtier apologised several times and then offered me a cookie as an apology for being in my path and the cynic in me got the best of me. I lost myself in cynical comments about how the courtier was trying to poison me with baked goods, probably spoken out loud.
TECH_AVG_YEARS_TO_PROGRESS: Average number of years until increase: §G$YEARS$§!
MAKE_PRIMARY_DESC: I can declare this my primary title
LOADSHIP_UNIT_FAILDESC: No navies present which are large enough to transport army
LOADSHIP_UNIT_FAILDESC2: Cannot embark a retreating or fighting army
title_court_jester_desc: The court Jester is kept around to provide general entertainment to the court. Also know as a fool it is generally not considered to be the most prestigious office at court.
title_master_of_the_horse_desc: This office dates all the way back the Roman Republic, and, in this era where a horse is a symbol of power, it is still very important. Although the Master of the Horse delegates the actual day to day running of the actual stables, much of the prestige of this office comes from the responsibility for the stud.
title_master_of_the_hunt_desc: In an era when hunting was an opportunity to demonstrate horsemanship and martial prowess, the hunt was serious business. The master of the hunt was a position of importance.
title_master_of_the_hounds_desc: With hunting considered the main pastime of the higher nobility, the hounds employed for the some of the hunts are thus important.
title_high_almoner_desc: The handing out of alms was an integral part of rulership and religious observance. The one responsible for this task is a very important personage.
title_seneschal_desc: Originally responsible for the organization of feasts and domestic entertainment. Although left mainly in the hands of deputies, the key role at such major occasions makes the post prestigious.
LOADING_TIP_3: Right-click on a holding in your realm to access a quick menu for it.
RAISE_NO_TROOPS_ALIVE: There are no troops left to raise.
RAISE_NO_SHIPS_ALIVE: There are no ships left to raise.
overthrow_ruler_no_calls_desc: §Y$CLAIMANT$§! has risen in revolt after a failed arrest attempt by §Y$TARGET$§!.
EVTDESC64010: [Root.GetSheHeCapOpp] is so funny and, above all, so beautiful! I think I am falling for [Root.GetHerHimOpp]...
EVTTOOLTIPA64011: [Root.GetFirstName] and [This.GetFirstName] has a wonderful time together
EVTDESC64011: No matter what I was doing or where I was, [From.GetTitledFirstName] always seemed to find me but seemed tongue-tied and shy. I was alone in the library, reading, when [From.GetSheHe] finally got the courage to talk to me...
EVTOPTA64011: You are so sweet! I like you too...
EVTTOOLTIP64012: [Root.GetFirstName] and [This.GetFirstName] becomes infatuated with each other
EVTOPTB64011: Go away! I don't like you...
EVTDESC64012: [From.GetTitledFirstName] and I talked for hours and soon became inseparable. If there was a chore, a homework or anything we could do together, we did it. If it weren't for my nanny then we would have slept in the same bed too.
EVTOPTA64012: Is this how it is when you are in love?
EVTDESC64013: I fled from [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s scornful reply and [From.GetHerHis] laughter that followed me down the stairs. How could I ever have felt anything for that, that... idiot?!
EVTOPTA64013: I have to accept that I'm a failure
EVTDESC64015: My wife [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] has grown old and less-than-attractive. Maybe a young mistress will bring some excitement to my life?
EVTOPTA64015: I'm sure my wife will allow me to indulge myself
EVTOPTB64015: My wife will probably not find out
EVTDESC64016: I have noticed how [From.GetFirstName] has stopped looking at me the way [From.GetSheHe] used to do, with a kind of burning desire for me and my body. These days, [From.GetSheHe] looks at the young courtiers with high bosoms and slender waists with the look that used to be reserved for me...
EVTOPTA64016: So [From.GetSheHe] did not think I would notice?!
EVTTOOLTIP64020: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] makes sure [This.GetTitledFirstName] understands [Root.GetHerHis] feelings about [This.GetHerHim] looking at other women
EVTDESC64017: [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s wife is a frail old thing who probably used to be beautiful. No wonder [From.GetSheHe] has started eyeing us lovelier ladies at court...
EVTOPTA64017: [From.GetSheHeCap] is not too hard on the eyes...
EVTDESC64018: [From.GetTitledFirstName] responded to my advances and soon we were... engaging in a very stimulating activity. In short: the love-making was amazing!
EVTOPTA64018: I think I am in love...
EVTDESC64019: The scorn I was met by when I tried to talk [From.GetTitledFirstName] into meeting me somewhere more private really hurt. [From.GetSheHeCap] actually laughed at my advances and told me I was both too old and too ugly for [From.GetHerHim].
EVTOPTA64019: I was taken aback by [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s scorn
EVTDESC64020: [From.GetFirstName] had noticed how I had started looking at the other women at court and the whispers about me flirting with the beautiful ladies at court made [From.GetHerHim] draw some conclusions [From.GetSheHe] obviously did not appreciate. I was yelled at for hours, or so it felt, about the 'sinfulness of adultery' and 'why don't you think I am attractive anymore?'.
EVTOPTA64020: I think [From.GetFirstName] is angry about me flirting with the ladies...
EVTDESC64025: It is as if I see [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] for the first time: [Root.Spouse.GetHerHis] good-natured spirit, the interesting and funny quirks [Root.Spouse.GetSheHe] has and how lovely [Root.Spouse.GetSheHe] really is. Could it be that I love my [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName]?
EVTOPTA64025: Embrace the love I feel for [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName]
EVTDESC64030: I have finally gotten a chance to do something special with my special someone and there are so many things I want to do! Should I try to entertain [Root.GetHerHimOpp] at the court, or maybe we should spend some time in my isolated country cottage?
EVTOPTA64030: I shall take [Root.GetHerHimOpp] to my isolated country cottage
EVTOPTB64030: I'll sponsor entertainment at the local court
EVTOPTC64030: Nah, I'll spend the time with my friends instead
EVTDESC64035: No matter what I do, my sweetheart never seems happy, complaining that we never do anything exciting together and sulks when I tell [Root.GetHerHimOpp] I have too much to do to be able to entertain [Root.GetHerHimOpp] all the time. Having a lover is more hard work than I thought!
EVTOPTA64035: Throw a big party for [Root.GetHerHisOpp] entertainment
EVTOPTB64035: Take [Root.GetHerHimOpp] to do something dangerous, like hunting
EVTDESC64040: I caught them together in our own bed, [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] and [Root.Spouse.GetHerHis] lover! I screamed for [Root.Spouse.GetHerHis] lover to get out and then confronted [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] about this...
EVTDESC64041: I thought [From.GetFirstName] would be gone for several hours, so when [From.GetSheHe] opened the door to the bedroom and caught my lover and I in a rather embarrassing embrace and, after [From.GetHerHis] initial surprise, shouted at my lover to get out I was speechless. [From.GetSheHeCap] demanded that I stopped seeing my lover, or else...
EVTOPTB64041: Anything for the sake of domestic peace!
EVTDESC64045: I don't know what has happened lately, no matter what my lover does I feel irritated and have actually started to avoid [Root.GetHerHimOpp]. Our relationship brings me only irritation, it is as if we have grown apart...
EVTDESC64046: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has avoided me for some time, and the rare occasions when we meet have turned from the love-filled evenings I remember to hours of arguing and disagreement. It did not come as a shock when [From.GetTitledFirstName] told me [From.GetSheHe] wanted to end our relationship but it hurt more than I thought it would.
EVTOPTA64046: In the end we parted as friends...
EVTDESC64050: Since we were small, we had always felt there was something between us, something that made certain situations more awkward than they should have been. Our teenage infatuation has deepened and grown into something more, something that is hard to explain...
EVTOPTA64050: Our infatuation has turned into love
EVTTOOLTIP64051: Does [This.GetTitledFirstName] feel the same as I do?
EVTOPTB64050: This was just something for us growing up
EVTTOOLTIP64052: Has the teenage infatuation turned into affection between [This.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.GetTitledFirstName]?
EVTDESC64051: The teenage infatuation I felt for [From.GetTitledFirstName] has turned into something more, maybe love, and I know [From.GetTitledFirstName] feels the same way as I do.
EVTDESC64052: [From.GetTitledFirstName] and I used to have a... teenage crush on each other and I met [From.GetHerHim] today and the old feelings welled up. Before I could say something embarrassing, [From.GetTitledFirstName] laughed away our teenage infatuation and told me that [From.GetSheHe] is still fond of me.
EVTOPTA64052: Yes, it was only a teenage infatuation...
LOADING_TIP_22: Children are born with a fraction of their parents' dynasties' total Prestige.
LOADING_TIP_23: Agnatic Succession means only males can inherit.
LOADING_TIP_24: Agnatic-Cognatic (a.k.a. Male Preference) Succession means females can inherit only if there are no valid males.
LOADING_TIP_25: Under Seniority Succession, the oldest member of the dynasty inherits.
LOADING_TIP_26: Under Primogeniture Succession, the oldest legitimate child inherits.
LOADING_TIP_27: Under Gavelkind Succession, the inheritance is divided among the children.
REVOKE_TITLE_INTERACTION_LETTER: We have decided to immediately revoke your title as [ThirdPartyTitle.GetFullName]. Failure to hand it over peacefully will lead to war.
EVTDESC20111:
My liege, I have tried to make [From.GetBestName] realize what a benevolent and peaceful ruler you really are, but sinister forces at [From.GetHerHis] court have been hard at work to discredit my every move and distort my every word. I am afraid that in the end the visit seems to have done more harm than good.

Your humble [Root.GetChancellorName],
[Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledName]
TITLE_ONLY_FEUDAL_CREATE_KING: Republics and theocracies cannot create kingdoms!
opinion_beheaded_dynasty_member: Beheaded a member of my dynasty!
EVTDESC64055: My child shows every sign of being infatuated with a courtier and follows the person in question everywhere.
EVTDESC64060: My love is married to another [Root.GetManWoman] and it pains my soul I will never be able to marry [Root.GetHerHimOpp] myself. Oh, how cruel love can be!
EVTOPTA64060: I will write a poem of my pain
EVTOPTC64060: I shall seek help from prayer
EVTDESC38286: I drink to forget and remember my trouble no more. I have gained the Drunkard trait.
EVTDESC64065: The unsatisfying relationship with a married [Root.GetManWomanOpp] is really becoming irksome. I wish I could love [Root.GetHerHimOpp] openly, without fearing everyone's scorn...
EVTOPTC64065: No, I will make it work!
EVTDESC64070: Seeing another [Root.GetManWomanOpp] behind my spouse's back is becoming quite troublesome for me, the lies tear at my soul and my longing to be with my lover is almost too much.
EVTOPTA64070: It's time to end such affairs and settle down
EVTOPTB64070: It will work out if I give it a bit more effort
EVTOPTC64070: I don't care for my spouse
EVTDESC64075: I am planning a special occasion with my lover, but my wife is quite insistent on alternate plans. Who is more important to me, my lover or my wife?
EVTOPTA64075: Ignore my wife, and go visit my lover
EVTOPTB64075: Arrange a ball and invite my lover
EVTTOOLTIP64076: Your wife [This.GetFirstName] meets your lover at the ball and learns about your adulterous relationship
EVTOPTC64075: Spend time with my wife instead
EVTTOOLTIP64045: You have lost that loving feeling for your lover
EVTDESC64076: I was glad [From.GetFirstName] wanted to arrange a ball and I invited all my friends for a night I would never forget. The ball was wonderful, until I met my husband [From.GetFirstName]'s lover.
EVTOPTA64076: How could [From.GetSheHe] do that to me?
EVTTOOLTIP64077: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] hates [This.GetTitledFirstName] for who [This.GetSheHe] invited to the ball
EVTDESC64077: My wife [From.GetTitledFirstName] came up to me, slapped me and left the ball. My lover came running after her and gave me a look that meant trouble ahead. My wife [From.GetFirstName] and my lover had met and my wife had learnt about our adulterous relationship.
EVTDESC64080: My wife has retired to the convent for a short while, to gather her thoughts and find some peace, maybe even God.
EVTOPTA64080: Perfect occasion to spend time with my lover!
EVTOPTB64080: Be discreet about spending time with my lover
EVTOPTC64080: Only see my lover on friendship terms
EVTDESC64085: I love [Root.GetHerHimOpp] and [Root.GetSheHeOpp] loves me, we are both adults and nothing or nobody will stop us getting married!
EVTTOOLTIP64086: Our eloping caught the attention of [This.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTDESC64086: Two people eloped, got married without anyone's consent except their own and it falls to me as their liege to either accept the marriage or do something about it.
EVTTOOLTIP64087: The elopers are caught and imprisoned
EVTTOOLTIP64088: The elopers are caught and banished
EVTDESC64087: [From.GetTitledFirstName] could not accept our marriage and now my [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] and I finds ourselves in the prison of [From.GetTitledFirstName].
EVTDESC64088: I almost regret eloping with [Root.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] as it caused us to be banished by [From.GetTitledFirstName]. But they say love conquers all and at least I have my [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] with me in my misery.
EVTOPTA64088: Banishing us for getting married? That's low even for you!
EVTDESC64090: We both want children, [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] and I, but we haven't been blessed with any yet. What do we do wrong?
EVTOPTA64090: Ask for [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]'s help with our childless marriage
EVTDESC64100: I had a fiery row with my wife [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName], worse than any we ever had before. My lover is eager to comfort me and I could really use some comfort right now.
EVTOPTA64100: Retire to the country manor with my lover for a while
EVTOPTB64100: I can have my lover in my castle
EVTTOOLTIP64102: Your adulterous affair is discovered by your wife [This.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTOPTC64100: I am strong, I don't need comfort!
EVTDESC64101: The 'comfort' my lover offered me has resulted in her being pregnant!
EVTDESC64102: Still fuming with anger after the fiery row with [From.GetTitledFirstName], I saw [From.GetHerHim] kiss another woman in the garden and then take her by the hand, leading her somewhere more private I am sure.
EVTDESC64105: The constant quarrels with [From.GetTitledFirstName] and [From.GetHerHis] adulterous affairs has brought me to a boiling point. If I ever loved [From.GetHerHim], that love has disappeared with this latest betrayal.
EVTDESC64110: No matter how discreet I have been with my lover, my [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] still manages to grow suspicious of my behavior. I think I might have tried too hard to be inconspicuous...
EVTOPTC64110: Make empty promises to [Root.Spouse.GetHerHim] about spending more time
EVTOPTD64110: Spend more time at home as [Root.Spouse.GetSheHe] wishes
EVTDESC64115: My lover accused me of loving my spouse [Root.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] more than [Root.GetHerHimOpp].
EVTOPTA64115: Buy [Root.GetHerHimOpp] an expensive gift to prove my love
EVTOPTB64115: Take [Root.GetHerHimOpp] to my country manor for some quality time
EVTOPTC64115: Assure [Root.GetHerHimOpp] of [Root.GetHerHisOpp] importance by words only
EVTDESC64120: I heard the news from my lover first, then the whole court was buzzing with the news. My spouse [Root.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] had made my adulterous affair public!
EVTDESC64125: My spouse [Root.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] has humiliated me publicly! [Root.Spouse.GetSheHeCap] kissed [Root.Spouse.GetHerHis] lover in public and now everyone knows about their adulterous affair!
EVTDESC64126: I was arrested and imprisoned by [From.GetTitledFirstName] when [From.GetSheHe] saw me kiss [From.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] in public, revealing to everyone our adulterous affair.
EVTDESC64127: I hadn't exactly surmised that my spouse [From.GetTitledFirstName] would have me arrested and imprisoned for kissing my lover and making our affair public.
EVTOPTA64127: I should've been more discreet with the affair
EVTDESC64130: I am married to a [Root.Spouse.GetManWoman] I love and it is such a blissful state! I wish everyone could experience love such as ours!
EVTOPTB64130: It makes you feel so healthy
EVTDESC64135: I want to give a special surprise to my loved one, what shall it be? A poem, telling of my deep love for [Root.GetHerHimOpp], finding the most beautiful flower in the forest to prove my love or maybe find a small trinket in the market for [Root.GetHerHimOpp] to treasure for ever?
EVTOPTA64135: I shall craft a love poem
EVTOPTB64135: I shall find the most beautiful flower in the forest
EVTOPTC64135: I shall buy something nice in the market
EVTDESC64140: This war is a necessary one, but the heart is aching worse than any wounds the war might inflict upon me, simply by being separated from my love. The camp has no lack in women willing to embrace those men who seek them out, and they might be able ease my pain, although for just a short while...
EVTOPTA64140: This war will deepen my love
EVTOPTC64140: Visiting some camp-followers should ease my pain
EVTDESC72052: Everyone drank and were happy, except [From.GetTitledFirstName] who refused more wine! This insulting gesture means that [From.GetSheHe] does not appreciate my hospitality!
EVTDESC72036: The duel was over when I reached them, [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s opponent lay wounded at his feet.
EVTOPTA72036: What on Earth have you done!
EVTDESC72037: [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s maimed opponent tried to stand up when I reached them, but collapsed once again at [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s feet.
EVTOPTA72037: Don't just stand there, help him!
EVTOPTA24505: Someone suspects I did not die naturally!
EVTTOOLTIP24506: reacts to the strange circumstances of [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s death
ISNT_PRIMARY_HOLDER_TITLE_TIER: Is not same tier as primary title.
IS_PRIMARY_HOLDER_TITLE_TIER: Is same tier as primary title.
EVTOPTA20370: Then use it as you see fit
EVTOPTB20370: It is just a rumor, let it be
EVTDESC70028: I was at the tournament and although I did not have an opportunity to distinguish myself in the melee, I was sitting around and listening to two knights plot together to advantage themselves in the next bought. I offered some advice, how was I supposed to know?
EVTDESC70001: It is time to let the tournament begin and for the next 2 months let all show their martial brilliance.
EVTDESC76000: Being male, unmarried and almost handsome in a court filled with young women who all seek your attention is not half bad. A particularly young wench, almost irresistible, desires the pleasure of my company...
EVTOPTA76000: Surely one night's passion won't tarnish my soul?
EVTOPTB76000: I won't soil my soul with a night of passion!
EVTDESC38287: My actions has killed a close relative of mine! I have gained the Kinslayer trait.
EVTDESC76005: My unwed daughter has been... indiscreet. She has been hiding her pregnancy from me and now presents me with her child.
EVTOPTA76005: Pay heavily to deal with it quietly
EVTTOOLTIP76006: Spymaster [Root.job_spymaster.GetTitledFirstName] advises you on how to deal with your daughter's bastard child
EVTOPTB76005: The child is of my blood and I will take care of both of them
EVTOPTC76005: Punish her harshly and give away the child!
EVTDESC76006: There are several ways to deal with this unfortunate situation,' Spymaster [Root.job_spymaster.GetTitledFirstName] told me when I asked [Root.job_spymaster.GetHerHim] for advice on how to deal with my daughter's bastard child...
EVTOPTA76006: Keep her hidden, then dispose of the child'
EVTOPTB76006: Slay the father and take the child away'
EVTOPTC76006: I don't want to know, just deal with it...
EVTTOOLTIP76007: Spymaster [This.GetTitledFirstName] takes care of the situation with your daughter's bastard child
EVTDESC76007: My liege [From.GetTitledFirstName] came to me, dragging [From.GetHerHis] daughter with [From.GetHerHim] with a newborn child in her arms.\n'I trust you to deal with my daughter's bastard child discreetly', [From.GetTitledFirstName] told me coldly and left [From.GetHerHis] daughter and her bastard child with me.
EVTOPTA76007: This is just part of my job
EVTTOOLTIP76008: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] failed to cover up [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s daughter's unwanted pregnancy.
EVTTOOLTIP76009: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] saved [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s daughter and her bastard child
EVTDESC76008: I trusted Spymaster [From.GetTitledFirstName] to deal with my daughter and her bastard child in a discreet manner but [From.GetSheHe] failed miserably!
EVTOPTA76008: Accuse Spymaster [From.GetTitledFirstName] of treason and imprison [From.GetHerHim]
EVTOPTB76008: I confess my part of this blunder
EVTDESC76009: Despite my clear instructions on how to deal with my daughter and her bastard child, Spymaster [From.GetTitledFirstName] let them live!
EVTOPTA76009: As long as I don't get involved, again...
EVTDESC76010: 'A bastard can cause a lot of trouble', insisted [Root.GetSpymasterName] [Root.job_spymaster.GetTitledFirstName] and advised me of a possible opportunity to get rid of the bastard in the court.
EVTOPTA76010: Go ahead, see if your plan works
EVTOPTB76010: I doubt the bastard child will cause any trouble
EVTDESC76015: A bastard son of mine petitioned me to recognize him as a legitimate heir.
EVTOPTC76015: I welcome you with open arms!
EVTDESC76020: Am I not all that any child could be? I should ask my father to be included in the succession!
EVTDESC76021: My illegitimate [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] asked me to acknowledge [From.GetHerHim] as my [GetFromRelation] and thus include [From.GetHerHim] in the succession.
EVTOPTB76021: I agree. You are a worthy heir
EVTDESC76022: I waited silently and patiently for my father [From.GetTitledFirstName] to answer my request to acknowledge me and include me in the succession. Finally, [From.GetTitledFirstName] answered...
EVTOPTB76022: ...that [From.GetSheHe] agreed and would legitimise me as [From.GetHerHis] child
obj_become_exalted_desc: [This.GetTitledFirstName] wants [This.GetHerHis] name to live forever in the annals of history.
EVTDESC76025: Raising a child on your own is hard, but raising a bastard child is even harder. We are an embarrassment to our family and very few of them are willing to help us.
EVTOPTA76025: My father might be able to help us
EVTTOOLTIP76026: [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s asks her father [This.GetTitledFirstName] to help her
EVTOPTB76025: I keep quiet and toil hard
EVTDESC76026: The embarrassment and black stain on our dynasty that is my daughter [From.GetTitledFirstName] and her bastard child asked me today to help her. I refuse to do this, blaming  the embarrassment that has been brought upon the family on...
EVTOPTC76026: ...the father of my daughter's bastard child
EVTTOOLTIP76028: The Grandfather, [This.GetTitledFirstName], is blamed for not raising his son properly
EVTDESC76027: [From.GetTitledFirstName] blames me for the difficult situation [From.GetHerHis] daughter is in, what with me being the father of her bastard child...
EVTOPTB76027: That has nothing to do with me!
EVTDESC76028: [From.GetTitledFirstName] blames me for the hopeless situation [From.GetHerHis] daughter is in, what with my son being the father of her bastard child...
EVTOPTA76028: I will take care of it
EVTOPTB76028: That has nothing to do with me, or my son!
EVTDESC76030: A dream is born and a sword sharpened...
EVTDESC76035: The other children at court tease me relentlessly because I don't have a real father. I'm a bastard and they know it!
EVTOPTC76035: Try to become friendly with them
EVTOPTD76035: Try to do bad things to them when they can't notice it's you
EVTDESC76040: People keep telling me I am a bastard but no one explains what it is! Maybe [Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] knows?
EVTTOOLTIP76041: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] asks [Root.GetHerHis] guardian [This.GetTitledFirstName] what being a bastard means
EVTDESC76041: [From.GetTitledFirstName] asked me while looking seriously at me with [From.GetHerHis] big, innocent eyes what being a 'bastard' actually means.
EVTOPTA76041: You are an abomination in the eyes of God
EVTOPTC76041: You will make your own way in the world!
EVTDESC39000: The [Root.Religion.GetName] heresy has reared its ugly head in the province of [Root.GetName]!
EVTDESC39400: The [From.Religion.GetName] heresy has appeared in the province of [From.GetName]!
EVTDESC39401: Disturbing news! Heresy apparently appeared in a catholic province over two years ago and the ruler has done nothing!
EVTOPTA39401: Horrible! I will write to him.
EVTDESC20001: My [Root.GetTitle], I am pleased to report that the majority of the population in [From.Location.GetName] has been converted to the [From.Religion.GetName] faith!\nYour humble vassal\n[From.GetTitledName]
EVTDESC39402: To find that you have a province in your demesne that has turned heretic is bad enough. But I am shocked to learn that you have let this situation be for over two years! This heresy must be rooted out.
demand_liege_title_desc: My liege holds a duchy that should rightfully be mine. I can present my demand, though it could be risky...
NOT_PLAYER_HEIR_DESC: §Y$HEIR$§! is not §Y$RULER$'s§! Dynastic Heir. For players, this means Game Over.
PLAYER_HEIR_DESC: The Dynastic Heir is the legal successor to a character. If a player has no Dynastic Heir, the game will end. On succession, the Prestige and [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] of a character is carried over to the Heir in the form of Score.
TITLE_CREATION_KING_DESC: You need to control §Y$REQ_PERC$%§! of its de jure Counties to create this title. Currently, you control $PERC$ ($HELD$/§Y$ALL$§!). Creating this title would give you §G$PRESTIGE$§! Prestige and cost you §R$GOLD$§! Gold and §R$PIETY$§! $PIETYNAME$.
TITLE_CREATION_KING_COST_DESC: Creating this title would give you §G$PRESTIGE$§! Prestige and cost you §R$GOLD$§! Gold and §R$PIETY$§! $PIETYNAME$.
EVTDESC39403: Heresy has appeared in a catholic province. I will encourage the local ruler to swiftly deal with it.
EVTOPTA39403: I will write to him immediately.
EVTDESC39404: Troubling news have reached me about a heretic province in your demesne. I urge you to swiftly deal with this problem as this heresy must be rooted out!
EVTOPTA39404: I will strike at these heretics!
EVTOPTB39404: Peaceful conversion is a better way
EVTDESC39410: There are rumors that one of the rulers of Christendom is employing a heretic in their court. This is not acceptable to the Church, and this earthly lord will surely be damned unless we intervene.
EVTOPTA39410: Demand that this advisor be imprisoned!
EVTDESC39441: I am most concerned that you allow heretics as your advisors. They should immediately be removed from position their position.
EVTDESC39445: My liege has a heretic as one of [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] advisors!
EVTOPTA39445: Shocking! I must send a complaint!
EVTOPTB39445: It is not of my concern
EVTDESC39446:
My liege, I am shocked to find that you have appointed a heretic as one of your advisors.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
AIREASON_FREE_VS_PAPAL_INVEST: Target has Papal Investiture and you do not
CONSTRUCTION_STALLED: §RConstruction has stalled due to enemy occupation§!
GRANT_LANDED_TITLE_INTERACTION_6: Grant the §Y[ThirdPartyTitle.GetFullName]§W and all titles under it to §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§W, increasing [Recipient.GetPossPronoun] opinion of you by §G$OPINION$§W.
desc_job_chancellor: The §Y$JOB$§! is your advisor on matters of diplomacy. The position is traditionally considered the highest on the council.
desc_job_marshal: The §Y$JOB$§! is the councillor in charge of the military. When the ruler cannot or will not command armies, the §Y$JOB$§! will do it.
desc_job_treasurer: The §Y$JOB$§! helps you collect taxes and administer your demesne.
desc_job_spymaster: §Y$JOB$§! is an unofficial position on the council. The office holder is responsible for all matters of intrigue and skullduggery.
desc_job_spiritual: The §Y$JOB$§! is your personal advisor on matters of the faith, but does not necessarily have to belong to the clergy.
CHAR_EDUCATED_LOG: §Y$NAME$§! is now of legal age. $PRONOUN$ became a §Y$TRAIT$§!.
EVTDESC70032: I was simply passing time at the tournament when I saw two knights argue over honor. I knew straight away that the argument was spurious and the result would be unnecessary bloodshed. I attempted to mediate the dispute and they told me that at least one of the knights should survive the resulting duel.
stop_commerce: Stopped commerce in all Church Squares
peasants_forbidden_sale: Peasants are forbidden to sell goods within City walls
clergy_extra_tithe: The Church collect an extra tithe on free peasants
EVTDESC77000: Fish! Fresh fish straight from the river!' 'Fruits and vegetables, a day or two old!\n\nThe clergy in [Root.GetName] is not happy about the merchants setting up stalls in all the Church squares, and demands that it be forbidden.
EVTOPTB77000: They do no harm, let them stay
EVTDESC77001: The burghers of [Root.GetName] demand that city law be set higher than canonical laws but the bishops protest, declaring that the law of the Church should supersede the law of the city.
EVTDESC77002: An old legal right, almost forgotten by all but the barons, called Prima Noctae or Droit du Seigneur, is the subject of a heated debate. The barons in [Root.GetName] claim that it is their right to take the virginity of their serfs' maiden daughters and the serfs are protesting against 'such a barbaric right!'.
EVTOPTA77002: Let the barons have some fun
EVTOPTB77002: That isn't and shouldn't be legal. I forbid it
EVTDESC77003: They come from smaller farms, some with a goat or a pig to sell, some with only a bushel of vegetables or fruits, others with a whole wagon of produce. The peasants sell their produce inside the city walls but the burghers protest against it and want to forbid it.
EVTOPTA77003: The peasants always cause trouble. Don't let them in!
EVTOPTB77003: They should be able to sell their produce inside the city
EVTDESC77004: The forest is not big enough for the barons. They demand hunting rights on the Church lands after chasing all the game to the Church's side of the forest and having to stop the hunt unless they'd risk the anger of the Church.
EVTOPTA77004: It's not a big deal. Let them hunt on the Church land.
EVTOPTB77004: Stay on your side of the forest!
EVTDESC77005: The clergy is not satisfied with collecting a tithe from all free peasants, they demand the right to collect an extra tithe! A tithe is a tenth of the peasant's harvest or a tenth of the craftsmen's production, if the priests were allowed to collect another tithe it would double the taxes and thus make the peasants protest wildly.
EVTOPTB77005: The peasants would starve, I won't allow it
EVTDESC77006: Rich merchants want to buy titles and the Barons protest, saying their titles are priceless. Mere merchant should not be allowed to gain the noble rights just because they can afford it!
EVTOPTA77006: As long as I get paid, I couldn't care less
EVTDESC77007: The Burghers, the Clergy and the barons all claim the right to spoils from shipwrecks that capsize outside of [Root.GetName]. The rights to the spoils will be given to...
EVTDESC72120: The travelling dancers first danced for us and, while dancing to a fast and glad tune which made me want to dance, invited everyone to join them. I danced until I panted and my face was red, then I had to sit down and rest for a while, watching the dancers and the courtiers having more fun than in a long time...
EVTOPTA72120: I'd like to hire you for my feast!
EVTOPTB72120: Great fun, but my guests are too old for this
TITLE_CANNOT_GAIN_INDEPENDENCE: Cannot create or usurp a title of the same or higher rank as our liege's
HAS_CROWN_LAW_TITLE: Affected by a Crown Law title
HAS_NOT_CROWN_LAW_TITLE: NOT Affected by a Crown Law title
EVTDESC60003: My liege, the great Khan Timur has gathered many of the horse clans of Central Asia under his banner, intent on creating an empire to rival that of the legendary Genghis Khan himself. His fearsome horde has been sighted in Khiva, poised to overrun the ancient realm of Persia.
EVTOPTB60003: Is there no end to these steppe warriors?
CANNOT_ACTUALLY_CALL_DESC_3: $CHAR$ cannot join any of the current wars fought by $CALLER$
ASK_FOR_INVASION_INTERACTION_DESC: Ask §Y[Recipient.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName]§W for permission to invade the realm of §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§W. This will cost you §R[GetPietyCost]§W [Player.Religion.GetPietyName], but will allow you to start a war for control of the §Y[Recipient.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]§W.
ASK_FOR_INVASION_INTERACTION_0: Ask §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§W for permission to invade the realm of §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.GetTitledFirstName]§W. This will cost you §R[GetPietyCost]§W [Player.Religion.GetPietyName], but will allow you to start a war for control of the §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]§W.
OTHER_WAR_ENDS_SETUP: A War you were NOT part of ends
CANNOT_CANCEL_ACTIVE_PLOT: §RCannot cancel a plot that has been set in motion!§!
EVTDESC3085: We are taught that to uphold the virtue of charity, we have to ransom our prisoners, and to forgive offenses willingly. I have prisoners in my dungeons...
EVTDESC69071: I gave a small shriek when [From.GetTitledFirstName] touched my arm, which didn't really help when I tried to defend myself from [From.GetHerHis] accusations about my cowardice...
CANNOT_CHANGE_ANOTHER_LAW: $RULER$ cannot change another regular Law in $TITLE$ until $DATE$
LOADING_TIP_29: You gain more Prestige in battle as an ally than as a primary participant.
LOADING_TIP_30: Hold down shift while giving orders to a unit to create a custom path.
alert_allies_not_called_in_delayed: We can ask the following allies to support us:\n$LIST$
alert_vassal_levies_raised_long_delayed: The following Vassals are upset about their levies:\n$LIST$
alert_owns_wrong_settlement_type_delayed: The following Holdings are of the wrong type:\n$LIST$
PREV_PROVINCE: Switch to the previous holding in this demesne
NEXT_PROVINCE: Switch to the next holding in this demesne
AI_WE_WONT_GIVEUP_YET: 'I still have untouched armies and holdings'
AI_WE_ARE_ACCEPTING_WHITEPEACE: 'I accept your offer of a white peace'
ATTACKTHEM_LOG: We have attacked the enemy in $PROVINCE$.
SIEGEUS_LOG: Our holding in $PROVINCE$ is under siege.
SIEGETHEM_LOG: We have laid siege to the holding in $PROVINCE$.
CONFIRM_DISBAND_DESC2: Due to enemy presence in our homelands, only $NUM$ of $TOTAL$ troops will be able to return home.
CONFIRM_DISBAND_DESC5: Due to not being in friendly territory, only $NUM$ of $TOTAL$ troops will be able to return home.

EVTDESC3525: I tried to not show how flattering it was to be asked about celibacy and if I had some sort of advice. Unfortunately, I had not the time to talk about right now...
EVTOPTC3525: I only do it because I fear God's wroth!
EVTDESC3530: A celibate life can be hard, but I fear life is harder for one of my courtiers whose sins our confessor often attack during his sermons. The poor sod's vices and lusts is controlling him and I don't envy him his time in purgatory.
EVTOPTA3530: I should be a good [Root.Religion.GetName] and help him
EVTOPTB3530: His sins are his own, no one can help him
the_flagellant_desc: Flagellants mortify their own flesh by whipping it
EVTDESC3535: Every other day, processions with people singing, carrying crosses and whipping themselves are marching through [Root.Location.GetName]. They ask to be forgiven for sins they have committed and believe the flagellation to work better than any other penance.
EVTOPTA3535: I will join them and my sins will be forgiven!
EVTOPTB3535: Isn't there a less painful way to be forgiven?
EVTDESC3536: We walked through the village, lashing our skins with whips for every step we took. As a [Root.GetTitle] this felt slightly humiliating but I stood tall and continued my pilgrimage together with my fellow flagellants.
EVTDESC3537: [From.GetTitledFirstName] walked together with the others through the streets of [From.Location.GetName], praying and flagellating [From.GetHerselfHimself] with a cattail whip made of knotted cords.
EVTDESC3538: Even before [From.GetTitledFirstName] opened [From.GetHerHis] mouth, I knew [From.GetSheHe] would comment on the pilgrimage I took while flagellating myself.
EVTOPTD3550: I'll sell those books I've already read
EVTDESC3559: [From.GetTitledFirstName] had a huge rose pinned to [From.GetHerHis] clothes and as soon as I saw it I realized it couldn't have come from any place else than [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName]'s garden. I wanted to rip the rose off [From.GetTitledFirstName] and yell at [From.GetHerHim] for having an affair with my spouse, but I controlled myself and turned away.
EVTOPTB3559: Why didn't [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] give the rose to me?
EVTOPTC3559: It hurts, but [Root.Spouse.GetSheHe] didn't intend it to be a token of love. I hope...

EVTDESC38289: My lovely garden does not bring me as much joy as it used to do. I have lost the Gardener trait.
EVTDESC38190: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] is feverish and has a headache. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] has gained the Ill trait.
EVTDESC38290: I don't feel so good. I have gained the Ill trait.

EVTOPTB3568: I'll ask my child to help me

EVTOPTD3568: I'll do it myself. This might hurt...

EVTOPTA3569: It looks rather harmless. I'll help you
EVTOPTB3569: This is as close as I'll get to that monstrosity!
EVTDESC3670: With [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s help it was easy to remove the beehive, until we dropped it on the ground...
EVTOPTA3670: None of us were harmed but the bees wasn't happy...
EVTOPTB3670: The bees managed to sting [From.GetTitledFirstName] several times!
EVTDESC3671: I had to remove the beehive all by myself when [From.GetTitledFirstName] refused to go near it. It looked harmless but [From.GetTitledFirstName] was sweating and looked as if [From.GetSheHe] would faint at any time.
EVTOPTA3671: Coward! It's your fault if the bees sting me
EVTDESC3585: My alchemy 'kit' arrived with a small book, containing instructions for how to mix different substances without causing things to explode or start burning. It might be a good idea to read the book before fiddling with the alchemical ingredients...
EVTOPTA3585: Nah, I start fiddling with it at once
EVTTOOLTIPA3586: starts fiddling with alchemy without any prior knowledge
EVTTOOLTIPB3586: researches alchemy before fiddling with it
EVTOPTC3585: I should be careful. I still remember what happened to my uncle...
EVTDESC3586: The liquid dripped through the labyrinth of glass bottles blown in various forms and sizes. As it reached the end of the funnel, a drop of the liquid quivered on the edge before it slowly fell towards the awaiting bowl.
EVTDESC3587: As the liquid slowly but steadily dripped into the bowl I waited eagerly for the substance to cool down. When finally every last drop was in the bowl darkness enveloped the castle and I had to light a candle to properly examine the liquid, which exploded.
EVTOPTA3587: What will [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] say when [Root.Spouse.GetSheHe] sees my face?
EVTDESC3588: The disappointment I felt when the liquid solidified was quickly replaced by joy when I realized that, instead of a Philosopher's Stone, I had created...
EVTDESC3590: This illness is slowly killing me, sucking the life out of my bones and brain. Being a mystic I have knowledge of a potion rumored to cure any illness but even as I prepare the potion I fear it might kill me instead of curing me...
EVTOPTB3590: I throw the potion away. I trust [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] will cure me!
EVTOPTC3590: A real doctor should be able to make me better
EVTDESC3594: I am desperate for a cure, the sickness seems to get worse for every day. I heard [From.GetTitledFirstName] had concocted something that [From.GetSheHe] said could cure all illnesses.
EVTOPTB3593: My child is sick, the potion might cure it
EVTOPTD3593: I don't dare let anyone try it
EVTDESC75065: [Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName]'s justice has brought peace to a troubled province. Fewer crimes are committed and fewer complaints are heard in the province. The peasants have never been happier!

After demonstrating how much pain [From.GetSheHe] could cause before the man passed out, [From.GetSheHe] taught me how to cause maximum pain and damage but still keep the victim alive for several days, or even weeks.
EVTOPTB3610: A great opportunity to test the brazen bull!
EVTOPTC3610: What is wrong with me? This isn't who I am!

EVTOPTC3611: No, no, not the brazen bull!
EVTOPTD3611: Not even the brazen bull can make me confess!
EVTOPTB3615: ...or maybe we should share a less bloody interest
EVTDESC38292: I used to love the clang of a sword's blade against another and the satisfaction I felt after defeating my opponent. Not anymore. I have lost the Duelist trait
EVTOPTA3625: Do you dare accept this challenge to a duel?
EVTOPTB3625: I'm sorry! I don't want to fight!
EVTOPTB3630: I have tired of this. Next time, I won't accept the challenge!
EVTOPTC3625: Marshal [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName], take care of this duel for me!
EVTDESC38293: The animals in the forest will from now on be safe from my bloodlust. I have lost the Hunter trait.
EVTOPTD3650: I'll ask my son to take care of the boar
EVTDESC3655: I overheard a conversation between two courtiers, they discussed how some in the court feared the Wild Hunt and laughed at how superstitious some can be. I decided to look into this and find out who this superstitious mind belonged to. Maybe I can have some fun with this fear of the Wild Hunt?
EVTOPTF3655: A child of mine is afraid of the Wild Hunt!
SAVEQUIT_DESC: Are you sure you want to Save & Quit to desktop?
MENU_BAR_SAVE_AND_EXIT_DEL: Does a Quick Save and then quits the game
NO_CREATE_BARON: Can only create barons in owned, minor baronies
tut_0a_4: The realm view is where you can get a quick overview of your realm. Your vassals, economy, history and more. Click on the shield next to the portrait to find it. You can click the 'De Jure' checkbox to see the regions that are tied to your title by bonds that will never break.
tut_0a_13: Piety. How the church sees you. Hover over the sum to see monthly gain or loss. Hover longer to see exactly what the sources are. You can also gain or lose piety from actions.
tut_0a_17: Score. This is your dynasty's total score. The score is calculated by adding the prestige and piety of each of your rulers at the time of their death. This will determine your final rank.
tut_0a_23: For different types of information, there are different map modes. We are in the terrain map mode right now. The independent map mode paints the name of the countries neatly over the map. If you zoom further in, the name of the individual provinces will pop up instead. Switch to the independent realms map mode now to see more defined borders.
tut_0a_25: The game starts paused. You can do all of the aforementioned actions while the game is paused or unpaused. However, nothing will actually happen until you unpause.
tut_0a_31: Alerts. These round icons show important things that need an action from you. It can be related to, for example, succession or diplomacy. Keeping an eye on them can make or break your fortunes, so ignore at your peril!
tut_2a_2: A ruler does not rule alone. You have access to five types of advisors that help you. The first advisor is the chancellor, who assists your ruler in the diplomatic field. Further you have the marshal, who is your resident military expert. Then you have the steward, who is in charge of your economy. The spymaster is responsible for keeping you safe from internal as well as external intrigue, and the chaplain is your guide in everything spiritual.
tut_2a_3: These vassals can perform missions for you. The chancellor can for example forge claims on foreign lands, while the steward can bolster taxes, all for the benefit of your dynasty! They also add their stats to yours.
tut_3a_2: Succession laws are what determines who you will play as next and what they will inherit. The most common start is that your eldest son will inherit most of your titles while your younger son(s) also gets their share. This kind of inheritance is called gavelkind.
tut_4a_2: Diplomacy is what we call the interactions between characters. It can be to start wars or send a child off to be educated. Now, to find a number of characters who you can use different diplomatic options on, click the ruler portrait to continue.
tut_5a_9: This time, also let's raise some levies from a vassal. If you were going to war, you'd probably like to raise all available levies using the button towards the top. For this exercise we just need a few though, so raise the personal levies of the Earl of Fife.
tut_5a_11: To gather them all in one place, select the new troops by clicking their shield and move them to the first troop by right clicking on the province. Unpause to continue.
tut_5a_15: We also have ships available. Click the military tab.
tut_5a_18: To load your troops onto the ships, select the army and in the top bar you can see an embark button.
tut_5a_19: Right now that button is grey though. To find out why, click your ships.
tut_5a_23: Click the button to create a new unit. Click the transfer button on one of the troops to move it.
tut_5a_27: As soon as your ships arrive, let's offload the troops in the Moray province.
tut_5a_29: Make sure you have the ships selected, then click on the tab to the upper right to select the army. Now you can click on Moray to have the troops go ashore there.
tut_menu_6_description: Learn about claims, casus bellis, peace outcomes and war score
tut_menu_5_description: Learn about units, levies, mercenaries, battles and sieges
tut_6a_8: After reviewing the province stats, open the council screen.
tut_6a_10b: Now you got an event pop-up. It says you now have a claim on the province which means you can go to war over it. Read it and click 'Press the claim' to continue.
tut_6a_14: Click on declare war. Now you'll see the casus belli we just arranged for. Click on claim Søroyar and hit send.
tut_7a_2: Plotting allows you to pursue goals in a less confrontational way than direct war. Other people can also plot against you though, so you always need to be prepared. Click the intrigue tab to continue.
tut_8a_2: Religion with all that implies, can have a big impact on what happens in your game. Crusades, piety and your own religious vassals will all play their part. The church head, which will be either a Pope, Caliph or an Ecumenical Patriarch, is the religious power for each of their religions. The Pope can not just start holy wars, he is also the one who can grant you a divorce for example. Click the religion tab to continue.
tut_9b_2: The hierarchy in Crusader Kings is strict, and those down the chain of authority provide troops and taxes to the ones above them, regulated by laws. Click next to continue.
EVTDESC3316: I found [From.GetTitledFirstName] in [From.GetHerHis] bedchamber, hiding from the sound of soldiers practising their sword fighting. I could not help but scorn [From.GetHerHis] cowardice.

EVTDESC3665: I was deeply absorbed in writing an ode to a nightingale when I was approached and asked if I could recite some of my poems for the court. Everyone had gathered inside to ride out the storm that had hit [Root.Location.GetName] so I had a fairly large audience.
EVTOPTA3665: This is a poem about courtly love... *ahem*
EVTOPTB3665: I think this poem about a sinful character will be entertaining...

CALL_ALLY_INTERACTION_LETTER_2: If we accept, we will be part of $WARLIST$
EVTDESC38294: I cannot get the words to flow as they used to and the idea to write my thoughts in poetry has ceased to be a necessity. I have lost the Poet trait.

EVTOPTA3675: Of course! What kind do you want? An ode, a sonnet?
EVTOPTB3675: For a small sum I would be happy to provide you with a love poem
EVTOPTC3675: You should give your sweetheart a poem of your own!
EVTDESC3676: [From.GetTitledFirstName] gave a piece of paper to one of the courtiers, who gave [From.GetHerHim] a kiss on the cheek before running of. Did my spouse [From.GetFirstName] just give a love poem to a courtier?
EVTOPTA3676: It probably does not mean anything
EVTOPTB3676: Why do I never get poems from [From.GetFirstName]?

EVTOPTA3677: Honey, the poem was for the courtier's sweetheart, no one else
EVTOPTB3677: Do these earrings prove my love for you?

EVTOPTA3680: [Root.GetSheHeCapOpp] kissed me when [Root.GetSheHeOpp] had read 'my' poem!
EVTTOOLTIP3681: The real poet finds out about your little lie
EVTOPTB3680: I had to tell [Root.GetHerHim] wherefrom I got the poem...

EVTOPTB3683: I did not seduce your wife, she threw herself at me!

EVTOPTA3685: I will find a new muse!
EVTTOOLTIP3686: finds a new muse for [This.GetHerHis] poetry
EVTOPTB3685: My inspiration is gone, possibly forever!
EVTOPTC3685: I... just... have to work harder!
EVTDESC3686: A muse is something more than just inspiration, you must learn to love and cherish your muse or else [Root.GetSheHeOpp] will leave you and take the inspiration with [Root.GetHerHimOpp]. I found my muse when I set my eyes upon...
EVTTOOLTIP3687: is approached by [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and asked to become [Root.GetHerHis] muse

[From.GetTitledFirstName] told me and scribbled furiously with [From.GetHerHis] quill on the already ink stained paper.\n'You are my inspiration, my muse. I will cherish our love forever!' [From.GetTitledFirstName] added after finishing 'the greatest poem ever! For now, at least'.
EVTDESC3688: My new muse [From.GetTitledFirstName] almost makes my quills burn with all the poems that want to be released unto paper!
EVTOPTA3688: Keep my inspiration flowing and I'll love you forever!
EVTDESC3689: No matter how many poems I wrote for [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetSheHe] just scowled at me and claims I 'disgust [From.GetHerHim]'. I feel my inspiration run short for every rejection and I have to admit to myself: [From.GetTitledFirstName] is not the muse I am looking for.

EVTDESC3690: I had just mounted my horse and was reaching for my bird when [Root.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] asked me to bring one of our children with me on the hunt.

EVTOPTC3690: I don't want to, and you can't make me!
EVTOPTD3690: Why don't you both join me?
EVTDESC3691: I saddled my horse as fast as I could, not wanting to wait for the clumsy stable boy to do it, and took my bird from the falconer. My [GetFromRelation] smiled at me and then gave the signal to let the hunt begin.
EVTOPTB3691: Wait, I am not ready for this...
EVTTOOLTIP3698: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] does not follow [This.GetTitledFirstName] on the hunt

Why was I told [From.GetFirstName] wanted me to join [From.GetHerHis] hunting party when [From.GetSheHe] didn't want me there?
EVTOPTA3692: I ignore [From.GetHerHim] and try to think on the hunt only
EVTOPTB3692: I'd better turn around, [From.GetSheHe] will be relived when I'm not around
EVTTOOLTIP3696: thinks [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has strange priorities during the hunt
EVTDESC3693: It was a great day for falconing, the sky was blue and the game was plentiful. My child [From.GetTitledFirstName], although maybe a bit unused to having to gut and skin the hunted prey, did very good and [From.GetSheHe] did not complain once.
EVTOPTA3693: I think it was good for both of us to do this together
EVTDESC3694: [From.GetTitledFirstName] refused to gut and skin the hunted prey the falcon brought, and it was pure luck my huntsman managed to grab the bird when [From.GetSheHe] panicked and let go of the tethers when the bird tried to fly off. The day went from bad to worse and I was not very happy when we got back home.
EVTOPTA3694: This was shameful! How could you disappoint me like this?
EVTDESC3695: The wager [From.GetTitledFirstName] and I agreed on was that the one who managed to catch the most prey wouldn't need to gut and skin any of it. I lost and, although I usually would rather not spend a whole hour gutting and skinning hares, this time I was too proud of [From.GetTitledFirstName] to really care about the slimy, gut-wrenching feel of intestines sliding through my hands...
EVTOPTA3695: I am impressed! No one has ever killed so many hares!
EVTDESC3696: [From.GetTitledFirstName] was more interested in flowers and herbs than the prey the birds hunted. When it was time to skin and gut the hares [From.GetHerHis] face literally went green and we had to stand back when [From.GetSheHe] lost [From.GetHerHis] lunch.
EVTOPTA3696: [From.GetTitledFirstName], you have to get used to this!
EVTDESC3697: I had a lovely day hunting with my birds, [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] and one of our children.
EVTOPTA3697: We will do this again, soon
EVTDESC3698: [From.GetTitledFirstName], although already in the saddle and with a bird perched on the pommel of the saddle, chose to leave the hunting party and ride back home.

My liege, my work in [FromFrom.Location.GetName] seems to have come to fruition. Your humble [Root.GetChancellorName],
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
